why: Managing emotions can lower pain intensity by reducing threat signaling.

slides.title: Pain-Emotion Connection
slides.content: Emotions and pain influence each other through shared brain pathways

slides.title: Anxiety Amplifies Pain
slides.content: Stress and anxiety can increase pain sensitivity by activating threat responses

slides.title: Emotional Regulation
slides.content: Managing emotions through mindfulness and CBT can help reduce pain intensity

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: Pain is purely physical. Fact: Emotions and thoughts modulate pain perception.

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: Relaxation is avoidance. Fact: Down‑regulating threat reduces pain amplification.

slides.title: Try this today
slides.content: 2 minutes of slow nasal breathing (4‑6 breaths/min) during a flare.
